etymologies: Middle English: from Old French goute, from medieval Latin gutta, literally ‘drop’ (because gout was believed to be caused by the dropping of diseased matter from the blood into the joints)

definitions: a disease in which defective metabolism of uric acid causes arthritis, especially in the smaller bones of the feet, deposition of chalkstones, and episodes of acute pain.
shortDefinitions: disease in which defective metabolism of uric acid causes arthritis

definitions: a drop or spot, especially of blood, smoke, or flame
